articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Construction Site of Monggumpho Fishery Base
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Construction Site of Monggumpho Fishery Base
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the construction site of the Monggumpho Fishery Base under the Ministry of Fisheries.
					 The large fishery base is now under construction in the area of Monggumpho on the western coast for salting and drying aquatic products. 
					
					 Being briefed on the layout of master plan of the fishery base, he looked round various places including wharf busy discharging tiny shrimps, drying ground and construction site of fishermen's hostel to learn in detail about fish haul and construction.
					
					 A consultative meeting took place on the spot.
					
					 It said that turning Monggumpho into a fishery base is the last instructions of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and an important work to translate the intention of Marshal Kim Jong Un into a reality.
					
					 It discussed a series of issues of energetically pushing forward the expansion of wharf and dredging and ensuring timely supply of materials necessary for the project by learning from the fighting spirit of the service personnel who are building the Kumsanpho Pickled Fish Factory and the Kumsanpho Fishery Station.
					
					 It took measures for building the pickled fish factory in the fishery base to further develop the Korean-style culture in producing pickled fish.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets Italian Ambassador
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets Italian Ambassador
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong met and had a talk with Italian Ambassador to the DPRK Sergio Mercuri who paid a farewell call on him on Tuesday.

articles.title: Congratulatory Visits Paid to DPRK Embassies
articles.content:
Congratulatory Visits Paid to DPRK Embassies
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Delegations of political parties and organizations and personages of all social strata of different countries visited DPRK embassies in relevant countries to congratulate the Day of the Sun (the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung) between March 24 and April 15.
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets before the portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and their full-length pictures and paid tribute to them.
					
					 They included delegations of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar, Myanmar Medical Research Institute, Arab Socialist Party of Egypt, People's Socialist Party of Mexico and the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), chairman of the Press Council of the Nepalese government, chairman of the Nepal Journalist Association, chairman of the Nepalese Association for Supporting the Songun Politics, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Bangladesh Communist Party, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Socialist Party of Bangladesh, president of the Bangladesh People's League, chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, chairman of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee, chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, general secretary of the Revolutionary Socialis
					
					 t Party of Peru, president of the Peruvian National Independent Movement for Free Voting's Union, president of the Peru-Korea Friendship Institute for the Study of Juche Songun Policy and the acting general secretary of the Popular Revolutionary Party of DR Congo.

articles.title: Floral Baskets, Bouquets Sent to DPRK Missions Abroad
articles.content:
Floral Baskets, Bouquets Sent to DPRK Missions Abroad
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Foreign political parties, ministries, institutions and organizations and personages of different social standings sent floral baskets and bouquets to the DPRK missions in relevant countries from April 7 to 14 to congratulate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Floral baskets and bouquets were laid before the portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and their full-length portraits. 
					
					 They came from the Commission for External Affairs of the Central Committee of the Communist Party, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Ministry of Defence, Ministry of Public Security, Ministry of Industry and Commerce, Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism, Fatherland Front, Academy of Social Sciences, Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union, Ho Chi Minh Museum, the Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Association, Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Kindergarten, Islamic Coalition Party of Iran, Islamic Revolutionary Mostazafan Foundation, "Workers' House" and International Taekwon-do Association, Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Myanmar, Chamber of Commerce and Industry, International Commerce Promotion Center, People's Party of Cambodia, Khmer Democratic Party, Ministry of Culture and Arts, Taekwon－Do Association of Cambodia, Czechoslovak Communist Party, Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association, Communist Party of Germany, Anti-Imperialist Forum, Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea, Workers' 
					
					 Party of Mexico, Mexican Friend Association for Memory of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, Mexico-DPRK Friendship Association, president of Senate of Cambodia, minister of Women Affairs, minister of Information, president of the Socialist Party of Benin, secretary general of the China Hong Kong Zhonghwa Energy Fund Commission, chairman of a business group and director general of a company and the co-chairman of the Council of the Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation.

articles.title: Palestinian Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Palestinian Ambassador Hosts Reception
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Palestinian Ambassador to the DPRK Ismail Ahmed Mohamed Hasan gave a reception at his embassy on Tuesday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Present there on invitation were Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong, Thae Hyong Chol, president of Kim Il Sung University and minister of Higher Education, and officials concerned.
					
					 The ambassador said the President set an example to be followed by the oppressed people in the struggle for freedom and independence. 
					
					 The Korean people are successfully carrying forward the revolutionary cause of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, rallied close around Marshal Kim Jong Un, the ambassador said, adding:
					
					 The Palestinian people will always stand by the friendly Korean people in their struggle for building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Ri Su Yong said that the friends of Palestine are joining the Korean people in celebrating the Day of the Sun every year. This is an expression of reverence for the President who made an immortal contribution to the human cause of independence, he stressed.
					
					 The revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by the President was successfully carried forward by Kim Jong Il and is now being successfully completed under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, he noted.
					
					 The Korean people will extend invariable support and solidarity to the just cause of the Palestinian people in the future, too, he added.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans Leave
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Leave
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Federation of Koreans in Canada left here on Tuesday.
					 Leaving here earlier were the delegations of the Council of Koreans in New Zealand and the Association of Korean Businessmen in Dandong, China.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- A home-visiting group of Koreans in Japan headed by Pak Hae Chol, vice department director of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Tuesday.
					 Members of the group laid bouquets before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: National Martial Art Championship for Mangyongdae Prize Closes
articles.content:
National Martial Art Championship for Mangyongdae Prize Closes
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The National Martial Art Championship for Mangyongdae Prize closed with due ceremony at the Taekwon-Do Hall on Tuesday.
					 It was opened on April 14. Players proved successful in the matches by giving full play to the Korean-style tactics, diverse technique and high physical ability.
					
					 In the Division I, the South Hamgyong Provincial Taekwon-Do team placed first.
					
					 In the Division II, the Pyongyang Taekwon-Do College came first.
					
					 In the Paduk games, the Pyongyang City Taekwon-Do Team came first.
					
					 Wang Myong Guk (man) of the Central Physical Training College and Kim Il Hwa (woman) of the Taekwon-Do State Team were awarded individual technical prizes at the Taekwon-do games.
					
					 Present at the closing ceremony were Vice-Premier Kim Yong Jin, Ri Il Hwan, department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned, players, coaches and working people, youth and students in the city. 
					
					 Kim Kyong Ho, chairman of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee, made a closing address.

articles.title: New Acupuncture Instrument Developed
articles.content:
New Acupuncture Instrument Developed
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- A new kind of rare-earth magnetic acupuncture instrument was developed in the DPRK.
					 In this regard, Ri Ki Hwan, a section chief of the New Technological Products Company under the DPRK Invention Office, told KCNA:
					
					 The acupuncture instrument is made of 12 magnetic needles, each 11 mm long and 3.6 mm in diameter, and has no adverse effect on human body.
					
					 Usable in any place, it is efficacious for many diseases, including urinary and nervous ones.
					
					 The clinical trials of the instrument show that it helps lower cholesterol count and rationalize the contents of magnesium and calcium and pH in blood.

articles.title: DPRK Strives to Utilize Natural Energy
articles.content:
DPRK Strives to Utilize Natural Energy
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The DPRK strives to make up the shortage of electricity by utilizing natural energy. 
					 Districts in the capital city of Pyongyang are making big efforts to settle lighting in parks and streets with use of natural energy.
					
					 Hamhung, Kaesong and other cities in the country have set up solar panels for lighting in streets.
					
					 Ryongchon County of North Phyongan Province is making effective use of solar and wind energies.
					
					 According to Kim Ho Chol, chief engineer of the Ryongnam Dockyard, the dockyard set up six wind-powered generators and 100 solar panels, all of which generate several hundred kwh in a day.
					
					 A similar drive was also launched in the Tudan Duck Farm, the stockbreeding base in the Sepho area and other rural units.

articles.title: DPRK Citizens Enraged at Sewol Disaster in S. Korea
articles.content:
DPRK Citizens Enraged at Sewol Disaster in S. Korea
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- It has been one year after the Sewol ferry disaster in south Korea, a deliberate genocide by the Park Geun Hye "government".
					 In this regard, DPRK citizens condemn the south Korean regime for having disregarded the disaster.
					
					 The last one year fully revealed the anti-social rule in south Korea, Ri Kyong Chol, section chief of the Law Institute of the Academy of Social Sciences, told KCNA, adding:
					
					 In the period the south Korean people have strongly demanded a probe into the truth about the disaster and the punishment of those responsible for it.
					
					 But the Park Geun Hye group turned aside such demands of the bereaved families and other south Korean people, refusing to make a heartfelt apology.
					
					 The group's inhuman and impudent attitude is well evidenced by the fact that Park set out on a foreign trip the day marking the first anniversary of the disaster.
					
					 Kim Hak Chol, a teacher of Pyongyang University of Architecture, said:
					
					 The anti-"government" struggle is getting more vigorous in south Korea with the first anniversary of the disaster as an occasion. This is a hard blow to the group of traitors.
					
					 The reality goes to clearly prove that it is impossible to prevent such disasters as the ferry Sewol case in south Korea as long as the group of murderers and corrupt elements remains in power.

articles.title: Sports Contest of Public Health Workers Opens
articles.content:
Sports Contest of Public Health Workers Opens
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The 3rd sports contest of public health workers was opened with due ceremony at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium.
					 During the contest, national-level healthcare institutions including the Pyongyang Medical College Hospital of Kim Il Sung University and the Korea General Red Cross Hospital and different units in Pyongyang and various provinces will compete in various events including basketball, volleyball and table-tennis at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium and the Sports Village in Chongchun Street.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Vice-Premier Kim Yong Jin, officials concerned, officials and other working people and players in the field of public health.
					
					 Minister of Public Health Kang Ha Guk made an opening address.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony, there took place men and women's volleyball games.

articles.title: Signal Successes Made in Planting Fruit Trees
articles.content:
Signal Successes Made in Planting Fruit Trees
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Officials and other people in the field of pomiculture in the DPRK have made signal successes in this year's spring drive for planting fruit trees.
					 At least 3 million fruit trees of various species including dwarf apple trees, pear, plum, peach and apricot trees were planted on thousands of hectares of orchards across the country. Spring fruit tree planting quotas were overfulfilled by 117 percent.
					
					 The Pyongyang Fruit Farm, Sariwon Fruit Farm and Toksong Apple Farm distinguished themselves in planting fruit trees.
					
					 The fruit farms in Pukchong County including the Ryongjon, Jongsan and Raha Fruit Farms planted fruit trees qualitatively.
					
					 Fruit workteams of co-op farms throughout the country planted a lot of fruit trees.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Stepping Up Construction of Sci-Tech Complex
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Stepping Up Construction of Sci-Tech Complex
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- If the Sci-Tech Complex is to be completed as a labor gift to be presented to the grand October festival, it is necessary to push forward the project as the one of the whole party and state and all the people, says Rodong Sinmun in an editorial on Tuesday.
					 The project means an honorable drive to carry out the strategy of the Workers' Party of Korea for building a rich and powerful country to outpace the world by dint of science, the editorial notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is a huge project on which the whole party and state should focus their efforts in view of its importance and significance, its vast scale and the limited time for winding it up.
					
					 If our march to the grand October festival is to be concluded triumphantly, all fields and units should render their sincere help in the construction ideologically, morally and materially and in manpower.
					
					 The project is not a simple economic and business matter but a drive for implementing the party's idea and defending its policies.
					
					 The editorial calls for winning a shining success in building the Sci-Tech Complex and thus powerfully demonstrating the heroic  stamina of the service personnel and people of the DPRK dynamically advancing, united close around the party.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Raps U.S.-S. Korean Warmongers' North-targeted Joint Military Drill
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Raps U.S.-S. Korean Warmongers' North-targeted Joint Military Drill
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Recently, the U.S. and the south Korean puppet warmongers staged a large-scale Ssangyong joint landing drill aimed to "occupy Pyongyang" as part of Foal Eagle joint military exercises. From April 10 they started Max Thunder joint air combat drill. They are, however, describing the exercises as "ones of defensive nature" to cope with the "threat of provocation" from the north.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article terms these joint military exercises typical offensive exercises and test nuclear war against the DPRK.
					
					 The article continues:
					
					 By staging Key Resolve joint military exercises till March 13, the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces confirmed once again the feasibility of the operation scenarios for invading the north to be applied in contingency on the Korean peninsula according to types and phases.
					
					 What merited a more serious attention was that the warmongers at home and abroad attempted to put into concrete shape the "tailored deterrence strategy" as a new operation plan in this year's Key Resolve and Foal Eagle.
					
					 Key Resolve and Foal Eagle brought into bolder relief their sinister scenario to ignite a nuclear war on the Korean peninsula and stifle the DPRK by force.
					
					 The tension can neither be defused nor durable peace be guaranteed nor the danger of a nuclear war be tided over on the Korean peninsula as long as the U.S. and south Korean warmongers persist in the north-targeted joint military exercises in south Korea.
					
					 If they continue staging madcap war drills to invade the DPRK, there can neither be dialogue nor can there be improvement of relations.

articles.title: Minju Joson Calls for Judging U.S. as Nuclear Criminal
articles.content:
Minju Joson Calls for Judging U.S. as Nuclear Criminal
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Marshall Islands in the Pacific recently filed a suit with the U.S. Federal Court against the U.S. administration for breaching its commitment to reducing nuclear weapons. Last year, too, Marshall Islands filed a legal suit with the International Court of Justice against Obama and relevant U.S. departments.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday in a commentary says it is quite natural that the U.S. was accused of being a nuclear criminal.
					
					 The U.S. was the first to make nuclear bombs and use them in the world and it was none other than the U.S. which threatened non-nuclear states with them and spawned the nuclear issue and it was again the U.S. which proliferated nuclear weapons, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. is resorting to high-handed and arbitrary practices in different parts of the world, depending on nuclear weapons. Due to its brigandish behavior the sovereignty of independent states is being wantonly violated and sound international order is put into confusion and, consequently, the world is thrown into a deep mire of wars and bloodshed.
					
					 It is the robber-like logic of the U.S. that it should deprive others of their nuclear weapons and no one but Washington is allowed to possess them and the world should yield to its nuclear stick.
					
					 The U.S. loud-mouthed "no nuke and anti-nuke campaign" is not workable on mankind any longer.
					
					 What mankind wants is only one action; to bring the U.S., the worst nuclear criminal in the world, to the international court and inflict just judgment on it.
					
					 The U.S. should make an apology to mankind for imposing a nuclear disaster and threat of nuclear war on mankind and beg for pardon.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Boost Cooperation with U.S., Japan in Scenario for Invading North under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Boost Cooperation with U.S., Japan in Scenario for Invading North under Fire
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The puppet minister of Defense of south Korea recently held a confab with the visiting U.S. secretary of Defense to discuss scenario for invading the north. Raising a hue and cry over "nuclear threat" and "ballistic missile threat from the north," they agreed to introduce latest war hardware into south Korea and steadily bolster up "all-inclusive alliance capability" under the signboard of "joint defense." Meanwhile, mandarins of the puppet Foreign Ministry held a consultative meeting on security policy with Japan in Seoul at which they cried out for increasing "the capability to jointly cope with the nuclear and missile threats from the north." 
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The south Korean authorities are becoming talkative about closer cooperation with outside forces in the campaign against the DPRK. It is nothing but shameless sophism reminding people of a guilty party filing the suit first.
					
					 Clear is the ulterior aim sought by the puppet forces in vociferating about the non-existent "threat from the north." It is to justify their moves to tighten the military nexus with outside forces for invasion of the north. 
					
					 Now the south Korean authorities unhesitatingly cooperate with Japan, the sworn enemy of the Korean nation, which is rushing headlong into militarization while watching for a chance of reinvasion, to hurt the fellow countrymen in the north with the backing of foreign forces. They are an unpardonable group of traitors putting the five traitors in 1905 into the shade. 
					
					 Their above-said behavior is little short of digging a pitfall of self-destruction. 
					
					 If the south Korean warmongers ignite a war against the north together with outside forces, the DPRK will blow up the bulwark of the provokers with the military muscle built up so far and accomplish the cause of national reunification.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Forces Accused of Insulting Victims of Ferry Sewol Disaster
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Forces Accused of Insulting Victims of Ferry Sewol Disaster
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on April 14 carried an editorial denouncing the puppet forces for insulting the victims of the ferry Sewol disaster.
					 The police sprayed tear gas liquid at bereaved families and citizens trying to stage a demonstration in demand of the abolition of the "enforcement ordinance" related to the special law on the ferry Sewol on April 11, the editorial said.
					
					 Such act of the regime fully revealed its attitude toward the disaster, it said, and went on:
					
					 The Park Geun Hye regime is a brazen-faced one utterly indifferent to the people.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Declare Actions for Probing Truth about Ferry Sewol Disaster
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Declare Actions for Probing Truth about Ferry Sewol Disaster
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Organizations of south Korea issued statements on April 16, one year since the ferry Sewol disaster.
					 The Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society said nothing has changed till today, one year since the disaster.
					
					 Actions will go on till the truth about disaster is probed and those responsible for it are punished, it held.
					
					 The Confederation of Trade Unions accused the chief executive of setting out foreign tour while paying no heed to the ever-growing demand of the bereaved families and other people for the probe into the truth.
					
					 It said that the confederation would start a general strike on April 24 to give vent to the resentment of workers.
					
					 The Federation of Trade Unions in a statement on April 15 condemned the regime for sidestepping the probe into the truth while talking about compensation money the bereaved families did not want, not content with blocking the activities of the ad hoc committee for investigation into the disaster.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Forces' Human Rights Abuses under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Forces' Human Rights Abuses under Fire
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Amnesty International condemned the south Korean puppet police's human rights abuses against south Korean people from all walks life demanding the probe into truth about the ferry Sewol disaster on the lapse of one year since the disaster. 
					 Amnesty International on April 18 issued a press release clarifying the stand critical of the fascist police's crackdown simultaneously in Seoul and London, according to CBS of south Korea.
					
					 It said that the south Korean police's suppression of rallies and demonstrations was an insult to the victims of the ferry Sewol disaster and all the bereaved families.
					
					 The police sprayed tear gas liquid in order to forcibly disperse the participants in the peaceful rallies, it said, adding this was a breach of international standard.

articles.title: S. Korean Police Censured for Suppressing Memorial Service
articles.content:
S. Korean Police Censured for Suppressing Memorial Service
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society in a statement on April 17 denounced the puppet police for suppressing the bereaved families and citizens who participated in a memorial service on the lapse of one year since the ferry Sewol disaster.
					 The fascist police on April 16 walked off bereaved families and citizens who were going to a temporary incense-burning altar at the Kwanghwamun plaza after a memorial service at Seoul Square, on charges of the "violation of law," the statement said.
					
					 It held that the organization could never pardon the police who walked away bereaved families and citizens on charges of the violation of the "law on assembly and demonstration."
					
					 It demanded the police apologize to bereaved families and citizens for illegally blocking the memorial service and set free those arrested at once.

articles.title: S. Korean Religionists Slam Puppet Group
articles.content:
S. Korean Religionists Slam Puppet Group
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Bishop Kang U Il, head of Jeju Church of the Roman Catholicism of south Korea, on April 16 denounced the puppet group for blocking the probe into the truth behind the disaster at a religious ceremony held one year since the ferry Sewol disaster.
					 He said that there are many suspicions concerning the ferry disaster, but nobody has given any explanation understandable and nothing has been clarified.
					
					 The regime misleads the public opinion by creating impression that the bereaved families were the first to mention money, talking about the "compensation," he noted, adding this was an insult to the bereaved families.
					
					 He went on: If the chief executive is working hard to cover up the truth behind the disaster, she will invite a greater disaster than the ferry disaster.

articles.title: S. Korean Body Publishes Action Slogans
articles.content:
S. Korean Body Publishes Action Slogans
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea on April 16 published the slogans calling for turning out in the actions to judge the Park Geun Hye group of traitors.
					 Park started her foreign tour indifferent to the demand of the bereaved families for rolling back the "enforcement ordinance" and clarifying the stand to salvage the ferry Sewol body, the organization said.
					
					 It set forth slogans for actions against Park.
					
					 The slogans denounced the Park regime for delaying the salvage of the ferry and demanded it probe the truth about the illegal funds for "presidential election".
					
					 They condemned the Park regime for staging south Korea-U.S. joint military exercises increasing the danger of war.
					
					 They demanded the regime stop the deployment of THAAD threatening the peace on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 They demanded the regime lift the "May 24 steps" and resume the tour of Mt. Kumgang to improve the south-north relations.

articles.title: Chief Executive of South Korea Censured by Koreans' Organization in U.S.
articles.content:
Chief Executive of South Korea Censured by Koreans' Organization in U.S.
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. released an article on April 16, one year since the ferry Sewol disaster in south Korea.
					 Deploring that the sorrow of the bereaved families has not been relieved nor has the truth behind the disaster been probed owing to the Park Geun Hye regime, the article said:
					
					 Her regime recently hurled policemen into spraying tear gas liquid against bereaved families and other people demanding the probe into the truth and walked off them.
					
					 Park is not entitled to be "president".
					
					 The article called for fighting against the Park regime and clearly showing the strength of the people.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Personages of Brazil, Kuwait
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Personages of Brazil, Kuwait
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Personages of Brazil and Kuwait issued statements on April 9 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Rosanita Campos, vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil, said that the President embarked on the road of revolution in his teens, founded the immortal Juche idea and led the arduous anti-Japanese war to victory, achieving the historic cause of Korea's liberation.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The President built socialism of Korea into one centered on the popular masses.
					
					 Under his leadership, free medical healthcare, free educational system and other popular policies were enforced and tax system was totally abolished in the DPRK.
					
					 He dedicated his all to the reunification of the country since it was divided by outside forces.
					
					 He made an immortal contribution to the global cause of independence.
					
					 His great feats and noble virtues are moving the people, and he is ardently revered by everyone.
					
					 Javid Ahmad, chairman of the Kuwait Asian Journalist Association, said that the President is the beloved father not only of the Korean people but of world progressive mankind.
					
					 The President's revolutionary exploits are shedding their rays thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Day of Sun Marked by Organizations of UK, Mexico
articles.content:
Day of Sun Marked by Organizations of UK, Mexico
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- UK and Mexican organizations issued bulletins on April 6 and 14 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun).
					 The British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in a special bulletin carried articles under the headline "Star of independence" illustrated with a portrait of the smiling President.
					
					 The bulletin in an article titled "President Kim Il Sung performed great feats in all fields" said that he led the arduous struggle for the country's liberation and prosperity and people's happiness to victory, adding he is, indeed, the most outstanding leader in the world. 
					
					 An article titled "The 50th anniversary of the great President Kim Il Sung's historic visit to Indonesia" introduced his visit to Indonesia and introduced how Kimilsungia came into being. 
					
					 An article titled "Kimilsungia" introduced in detail its biological features and technology of cultivation and immortal flower festivals being held worldwide.
					
					 The bulletin of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism carried an article titled "Comrade Kim Il Sung, eternal leader of Korean people" which dealt with the immortal revolutionary career and feats of the peerlessly great man who dedicated his all to the country and its people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Indonesian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Indonesian Paper
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The full text of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Kimilsungia Is an Immortal Flower Blooming in the Hearts of Humankind in the Era of Independence" was carried by the Indonesian paper International Media on April 8.
					 The work, published on April 6, Juche 94 (2005), deals with the historic position of Kimilsungia and significance of its cultivation and indicates the tasks for bringing the flower of the sun, a treasure common to mankind, into full bloom everywhere in Korea. 
					
					 The paper carried the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Finland
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Finland
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Become Pillars Supporting a Prosperous Future Korea" was brought out in booklet by the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					 Kim Jong Un made a congratulatory speech at the joint national meeting of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) organizations on June 6, Juche 101 (2012) in celebration of the 66th founding anniversary of the KCU. In the speech he expressed his firm will to invariably carry forward the noble outlook of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on the future and the rising generation. 
					
					 He indicated the tasks and ways to bring up the KCU members as knowledgeable, virtuous and healthy reserve forces which will be responsible for the future destiny of the country and the nation. 
					
					 A book releasing ceremony took place in Helsinki on April 13.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans Hold Rallies and Demos to Observe Anniversary of Ferry Sewol Tragedy
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Hold Rallies and Demos to Observe Anniversary of Ferry Sewol Tragedy
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Overseas Koreans held rallies and demonstrations one year since the ferry Sewol disaster.
					 Koreans in the U.S. held a rally in front of the consulate general of south Korea in Los Angeles on April 16.
					
					 The participants in the rally deplored that 304 people met grievous deaths in the disaster, adding that although it is one year since the disaster, nobody knows how they died.
					
					 The participants expressed the determination to fight to the last with the bereaved families of the victims of the ferry disaster for probing the truth behind the disaster.
					
					 Koreans in Germany including students studying there held a rally at Brandenburg Gate of Berlin to honor the memory of the victims of the ferry disaster.
					
					 The organization of Koreans in Berlin which has been fighting for probing the truth behind the disaster in a statement condemned the unpopular action of the Park Geun Hye regime.
					
					 Koreans in London and Paris also staged demonstrations demanding a thorough probe into the truth behind the disaster.

articles.title: Japan's Suppression of Chongryon Denounced by Foreign Organizations
articles.content:
Japan's Suppression of Chongryon Denounced by Foreign Organizations
Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Organizations of different countries released statements between March 30 and April 8 in denunciation of Japan's suppression of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					 The Iranian Workers' House bitterly denounced the Japanese reactionaries for searching the houses of the chairman and a vice-chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The illegal intrusion into the houses of senior officials of Chongryon shows what extent Japan's hostility toward the DPRK and the Korean nation has reached.
					
					 We demand the Japanese authorities take immediate measures for respecting the rights of the Korean residents in Japan.
					
					 The Sweden-Korea Friendship Association stated:
					
					 The search for the houses of Chairman Ho Jong Man and Vice-Chairman Nam Sung U of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee who are deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK was an illegal discrimination against the Koreans in Japan and human rights abuses against them and an unpardonable provocation against the DPRK and infringement on its sovereignty.
					
					 The Japanese police authorities' fascist action will seriously affect the DPRK-Japan relations as it will push them to the worst phase.
					
					 The France-Korea Friendship Association said that the search for the houses of senior officials of Chongryon could never be justified as it was perpetrated, pursuant to the Japanese authorities' moves against Chongryon.

articles.title: Embajador palestino ofrece banquete
articles.content:
Embajador palestino ofrece banquete
Pyongyang, 21 de abril (ACNC) -- Con motivo del Dia del Sol, dia de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung, el embajador palestino acreditado en Corea, Ismail Ahmed Mohamed Hasan, ofrecio el dia 21 un banquete en su sede diplomatica. 
					Fueron invitados el canciller Ri Su Yong, el rector de la Universidad Kim Il Sung y ministro de Educacion Superior, Thae Hyong Chol y otros funcionarios coreanos. 
					
					Ismail Ahmed Mohamed Hasan encomio en su discurso las proezas del lider coreano quien creo el modelo en la lucha de los pueblos oprimidos por la libertad y la independencia. 
					
					Apunto que hoy dia, el pueblo coreano, unido en torno al Mariscal Kim Jong Un, continua satisfactoriamente la causa revolucionaria del Presidente Kim Il Sung y del Dirigente Kim Jong Il. 
					
					Destaco que el pueblo palestino estara siempre al lado del amistoso pueblo coreano que construye un Estado prospero socialista. 
					
					Le siguio en usar la palabra el canciller coreano Ri Su Yong.
					
					Ri senalo que los amigos palestinos celebran cada ano el Dia del Sol junto con el pueblo coreano, lo cual expresa la veneracion hacia el Presidente Kim Il Sung quien hizo gran aporte a la causa de la independencia de la humanidad. 
					
					Menciono que la causa revolucionaria del Juche, iniciada por el Presidente, la continuo con firmeza el Dirigente Kim Jong Il y se lleva adelante bajo la guia del Mariscal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					Enfatizo que en adelante tambien el pueblo coreano enviara el invariable apoyo y solidaridad a la justa causa del pueblo palestino.

articles.title: Delegaciones y personalidades de varios paises visitan embajadas coreanas
articles.content:
Delegaciones y personalidades de varios paises visitan embajadas coreanas
Pyongyang, 21 de abril (ACNC) -- Para celebrar el Dia del Sol, las delegaciones de los partidos politicos y entidades y las personalidades de distintos estratos de varios paises visitaron del 24 de marzo al 15 de abril las embajadas coreanas en sus respectivos paises. 
					Entre ellos figuran la delegacion del Partido de Solidaridad y Desarrollo de la Union de Myanmar, la del Instituto de Homogeneidad de Myanmar, la del Partido Arabe Socialista de Egipto, la del Partido Socialista del Pueblo de Mexico, la del Comite Mexicano de Estudio del Kimilsungismo-Kimjongilismo, el secretario general del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Nepal (Marxista－Leninista), el presidente del Consejo de Prensa del gobierno nepales, el presidente de la Asociacion de Periodistas de Nepal, el presidente de la Asociacion de Apoyo a la Politica de Songun de Nepal, el secretario general del Comite Central del Partido Comunista, el secretario general del CC del Partido Socialista, el presidente de la Liga Popular y el presidente del Grupo de Estudio de la Politica de Songun, de Bangladesh, el presidente del Comite de Amistad y Solidaridad Bangladesh-Corea, el presidente del Frente Obrero, Campesino, Estudiantil y Popular, el secretario general del Partido Socialista Revolucionario, el presidente del Movimiento de la Independencia Nacional para la Union de Voto Libre, del Peru, el presidente del Instituto de Amistad Peru-Corea para el Estudio de la Politica de Songun del Juche y el secretario general interino del Partido Revolucionario Popular de Congo Democratico. 
					
					Los visitantes rindieron el homenaje a los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il tras colocar cestos y ramos de flores ante sus retratos con amplia sonrisa y las imagenes de esos dos grandes hombres encontrandose juntos de pie.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju averigua en el terreno campo de construccion de base pesquera de Monggumpho
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju averigua en el terreno campo de construccion de base pesquera de Monggumpho
Pyongyang, 21 de abril (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Pak Pong Ju averiguo en el terreno el campo de construccion de la base pesquera de Monggumpho del Ministerio de Industria Pesquera.
					Se esta construyendo en la zona de Mongunpho del Mar Oeste de Corea la distinguida base pesquera capaz de realizar universalmente la saladura, la secada y otros procesamientos de productos maritimos.
					
					Tras escuchar la explicacion del plan de conformacion de base pesquera de Monggumpho, el premier recorrio varios puntos inclusive del muelle, el secadero y el albergue de pescadores y averiguo en detalle el estado de la pesca y la construccion.
					
					Tuvo lugar en el terreno la reunion consultiva de los funcionarios de las ramas interesadas.
					
					En la ocasion, se dio enfasis a que la transformacion la zona de Monggunpho en una base distinguida de pesca es el legado de los grandes Lideres y es el trabajo importante para realizar el proposito del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Fueron debatidos el tema de realizar activamente la obra de ensanche del muelle y de dragado y suministrar a tiempo los materiales necesarios a la obra, al aprender de modo de trabajo del Ejercito Popular, y otros asuntos.
					
					Y se tomaron medidas para desarrollar la cultura coreana de escabeche al construir en esta base pesquera la fabrica de procesamiento de escabeche.

articles.title: Tragedia del ferry "Sewol" es una masacre
articles.content:
Tragedia del ferry "Sewol" es una masacre
Pyongyang, 21 de abril (ACNC) -- Paso un ano desde cuando ocurriera el hundimiento del ferry surcoreano "Sewol" que dejo consternado al mundo.
					Esta tragedia fue una masacre cometida por el "poder" de Park Geun-hye.
					
					Un ano desde el hundimiento de "Sewol" fue el tiempo en que se conocio mejor el caracter antipopular de la gobernacion del actual "poder" surcoreano.
					
					Asi opina Ri Kyong Chol, jefe de seccion del Instituto del Derecho de la Academia de Ciencias Sociales de Corea.
					
					Durante un ano, toda la extension surcoreana se lleno de lagrimas de los familiares de victimas y se hizo escenario de la lucha de los habitantes que exigieron el castigo a los asesinos y el esclarecimiento de la verdad.
					
					Pero, en vez de pedir disculpas, la banda de Park Geun-hye trata de eludir la responsabilidad enganando la opinion publica y esto hiere doblemente a los familiares de victimas y otros habitantes.
					
					En el dia en que se cumple un ano del hundimiento de ferry, la mandataria surcoreana inicio su gira al extranjero causando gran indignacion.
					
					El profesor de la Universidad de Arquitectura de Pyongyang, Kim Hak Chol, dijo como sigue:
					
					La lucha antigubernamental, que toma auge con motivo del primer aniversario del caso de "Sewol", es un castigo severo a la banda traidora surcoreana.
					
					En distintas localidades surcoreanas fueron organizadas las entidades civiles y sociales, inclusive "Reunion Nacional de Medida de Tragedia del ferry 'Sewol'", y no cesa la lucha para demandar el saque a flote del barco siniestrado y otras cosas.
					
					La realidad advierte que se repetiran las tragedias iguales a la del ferry "Sewol" mientras exista el grupo de asesinos y corruptos como la camarilla de Park.
